intro: Pearsonia cajanifolia subsp. cryptantha, commonly known as the cryptantha pearsonia, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to greenish flowers. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
